alert.note: Alert for Orange (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 08 at 4:30PM EDT until further notice by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east central Florida, including the following counties, Orange, Seminole and Volusia. * WHEN...Until 630 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 430 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Orlando, Deltona, Sanford, Altamonte Springs, Oviedo, Winter Springs, Winter Park, Casselberry, New Smyrna Beach, Maitland, Lake Mary, Longwood, Wedgefield, Lake Jessup, Geneva, Chuluota, University Of Central Florida, Goldenrod, Bithlo and Azalea Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
